item.title: Report E-2023110125
item.description:
Report E-2023110125

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-03
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LDA experienced a UN2680 Lithium Hydroxide release from a 50-pound poly bag. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. : Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 pound of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. The damaged bag and all released material were collected and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110266
item.description:
Report E-2023110266

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-06
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 6, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1263 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. Personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the paint- impacted trailer to the extent practicable. The damaged pail and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for transport and disposal.

item.description:
Report X-2023110275

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-31
  • City: ODESSA
  • State: TX

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: RESPONDER WAS NOTIFIED OF A SPILL UNDER EXTENDED BELT. RESPONDER RESPONDED WITH PPE AND SPILL CAR. RESPONDER ESTABLISHED HOTZONE AND NOTICED STRONG ODOR, FUMES AND VAPORS. FOLLOWED DECISION TREE. FOLLOWED CHAIN OF COMMAND. OUTSIDE RESPONDER WAS CALLED.

item.description:
Report X-2023110125

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-29T18:13:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-23
  • City: EL PASO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Steel Pail was found in the unload empty and leaking. Upon founding pail, pail was placed in a red tote to stop leakage and any further damage. DescribePack: Steel pail had a dent on the bottom of and empty. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pail was placed inside red tote to stop leakage and placed under hood.

item.description:
Report X-2023110121

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS FOUND NEAR AN UNLOAD DOOR TORN AND WET. PAINT CANS HAD FALLEN OUT. THIS IS A CALL TAG PACKAGE. DescribePack: ONE CAN HAD A SLIGHTLY LOOSE LID AND FELT HALF EMPTY. BOX AND OTHER CANS WERE SOILED BY LEAKAGE. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: BOX AND CANS WERE PLACED INTO SALVAGE DRUM.

item.title: Report E-2023110148
item.description:
Report E-2023110148

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-31
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GREENWOOD MOTOR LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Trailer# OA6402 arriving from CTA terminal contained a spill inside of the trailer. Eight (1-G) cartons were crushed in transit from heavier freight stacked on top with no dunnage. Cleaned in house. One gallon spilled on the trailer floor. Contained to trailer. Door# 85. All material was placed into an overpack for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110106
item.description:
Report E-2023110106

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-27
  • City: GREENVILLE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORTHEAST TEXAS FARMERS CO-OP
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Train traveling Westbound at approximately 9mph.was going gown hill and around a curve. Engineer felt train dragging. as he began to slow down the rear car came in view and noticed a cloud of dust. An initial walk around inspection was completed to ensure product was not leaking. Wholes on the tank belly were not visible until car was rerailed and reassembled for movement. The truck punctured wholes around the belly of the car about 3 to 4 inches in diameter

item.description:
Report X-2023110192

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-26
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DMP RECEIVED A CALL ABOUT A PACKAGE CAR WITH A LEAKING PACKAGE. WHEN THE RESPONDER ARRIVED FOUND THAT A HAZMAT PACKAGE WAS LEAKING THAT CONTAINED A CYLINDER WITH AN OPEN VALVE. THE RESPONDER CLEANED THE SPILL FOLLOWING ALL DMP PROCEDURES. THE HAZMAT WAS THEN BROUGHT BACK TO DMP AND PROCESSED FOLLOWING ALL DMP PROCEDURES WITHOUT INCIDENT.
